title: 110_hr6813
content: The Act titled "New IDEA (Illegal Deduction Elimination Act)" clarifies that wages paid to unauthorized aliens cannot be deducted from gross income. The Act "New IDEA (Illegal Deduction Elimination Act)" prohibits deductions for wages paid to unauthorized aliens as defined by the Immigration and Nationality Act. The Safe Harbor provision in the basic pilot program exempts employers from penalties for hiring unauthorized aliens if they comply with program terms. Additionally, a 6-year limitation on assessing and collecting taxes applies to deductions claimed for wages paid to unauthorized aliens. The 6-year limitation on assessing and collecting taxes for deductions claimed for wages paid to unauthorized aliens is outlined in section 162(c)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Amendments to the Immigration and Nationality Act allow for the use of documentation, including tax violations, for enforcement purposes. The program established by the Commissioner of Social Security, the Secretary of the Department of Homeland Security, and the Secretary of the Treasury aims to share information to identify unauthorized aliens, including details related to section 162(c)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Additionally, there are provisions for disclosure by the Secretary of the Treasury under subsection (i) of section 6103 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow disclosure of taxpayer identity information of employers who paid wages not allowed for deduction under section 162(c)(4) and individuals who received such wages, upon request from the Commissioner of Social Security or the Secretary of Homeland Security, for enforcement activities. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow disclosure of taxpayer identity information of employers and individuals related to wages not allowed for deduction. Record-keeping requirements are updated, and the effective date of the Act and amendments is specified. SEC. 3. MODIFICATION OF BASIC PILOT PROGRAM FOR EMPLOYMENT ELIGIBILITY VERIFICATION. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996, specifically regarding making permanent changes and allowing current employees to participate in a pilot program for identity and employment eligibility verification. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996, specifically regarding establishing a rebuttable presumption for individuals employed by a person or entity to not violate section 274A(a)(2). The scope of the election allows the application to all hiring, recruitment, referral, and individuals employed by the person or entity.
